DataElement.preferredName: Patient Protein Urinalysis Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to patient's urine protein as a criteria in determining eligibility in medical care programs and services.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to patient's urine protein as a criteria in determining eligibility in medical care programs and services.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any of a group of complex organic macromolecules that contain carbon, hydrogen, oxygen, nitrogen, and usually sulfur and are composed of one or more chains of amino acids. Proteins are fundamental components of all living cells and include many substances, such as enzymes, hormones, and antibodies, that are necessary for the proper functioning of an organism.:A test that determines the content of the urine.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A group of complex organic macromolecules composed of one or more chains (linear polymers) of alpha-L-amino acids linked by peptide bonds and ranging in size from a few thousand to over 1 million Daltons. Proteins are fundamental genetically encoded components of living cells with specific structures and functions dictated by amino acid sequence.

Laboratory analysis of urine, commonly used to aid in the diagnosis of disease or to detect the presence of a specific substance. It involves examination of the urine by physical or chemical means as well as microscopic examination that helps to screen for urinary tract infections, renal disease, and diseases of other organs, that result in abnormal metabolites (break-down products) appearing in the urine.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have one of
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have one of the following: a urine dipstick for proteinuria less then 2+ OR If urine dipstick for proteinuria is greater then 2+, does the 24 hour urine demonstrate less then or equal to 1 g protein in 24 hours OR a urine protein-to-creatinine ratio (UPCR) less then or equal to 1.0 mg/dL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a urine protein of less than or equal to 2+ by dipstick or a 24-hour protein level of less than or equal to 3.5 g/24 hours?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the urine protein less than 2+ on urine analysis or 24-hour urine protein?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a urine protein of less than 2+ on dipstick or a 24-hour urine protein of < 1000 mg (<1.0 g/24hrs)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the urine protein less than or equal to 1 on dipstick (or if 2+ or higher, is urine protein less than 1.0g/24 hours)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have clinically significant proteinuria (urine protein ration greater than or equal to 1.0)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the urine protein creatinine ratio (UPC) less than or equal to 1 or less than or equal to 2+ proteinuria on two consecutive dipsticks taken no less than 1 week apart, or if the patient has 2+ proteinuria on dipstick, did patient also have a 24 hour urine collection demonstrating protein of less than or equal to 500mg over 24 hours?

ReferenceDocuments.name: eligibility question
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have one of the following: urine protein-to-creatinine ratio (UPCR) less then or equal to 1.0 mg/dL OR a urine dipstick for proteinuria less then or equal to 2+ OR If urine dipstick for proteinuria is greater then or equal to 2+, does the 24 hour urine demonstrate less then or equal to 500mg protein in 24 hours?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's urine protein creatinine (UPC) ratio greater than 1.0gm

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the urine protein level < 1.0g of protein per 24 hours?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's urine protein creatinine (UPC) ratio greater than 1.0?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have urine protein creatinine ratio (UPC) of less than or equal to 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a urinalysis (dipstick) showing less than or equal to 1+ proteinuria OR a urine protein creatinine ratio (UPCR) less than 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the urine protein level less than 1.0g of protein per 24 hours or was the UPC ratio less than 1.0?

DataElement.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
